Verse: Title: Melissa's eyes are sore.

One day a girl named Melissa was sitting outside her house. But Melissa wasn't happy because her eyes were very sore. She thought that some sand was in her eyes. So she called a friend named Janet and said to her, “Please look at my eyes. Is some sand in my eyes?”~!~one_day (NP a[Pre-Nominal] girl (NP named Melissa ) ) (VP was[Pre-Verbal] sitt+ing[Participle] ) (NP outside (NP _ her ) house ) . but (NP Melissa ) (VP was not[Post-Verbal] ) (AdjP happy ) [ because (NP (NP _ her ) eye+s[Plural] ) (VP were ) (AdjP very[Pre-Adjective] sore ) ] . (VP is[CP-VP] ) (NP (AdjP some ) sand ) (VP ) (NP in (NP _ my ) eye+s[Plural] ) ? . ”
Janet said to Melissa, “Nothing is in your eyes. But your eyes are very red.”
Then Janet said to Melissa, “Please look at my eyes because they also are very sore.” So Melissa looked at Janet's eyes. Janet's eyes were very red!

Then Melissa went into her house to rest. She slept for about one hour. Then she woke up. While Melissa was in her house, she heard Janet talking to a friend named Alex.~!~then (NP Melissa ) (VP went ) (NP into (NP _ her ) house ) [ to (NP ) (VP rest ) ] . Melissa called Alex loudly. She shouted, “Alex, come into my house. Something is preventing me from opening my eyes! I'm not able to see!”~!~(NP Melissa ) (VP call+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP Alex ) (AdvP loudly ) . (NP she ) (VP shout+ed[Past_Tense] ) [ ,_“ (NP Alex , ) (NP ) (VP come ) (NP into (NP _ my ) house ) ] . Then Alex entered Melissa's house quickly. There were many flies inside Melissa's house. And there were many flies near Melissa's eyes. Alex knew that Melissa's eyes were very sick. He said to Melissa, “Yellow pus is covering your eyes. This pus is preventing you from opening your eyes.”

Then Alex said to Melissa, “I'll try to clean your eyes. But I don't have a clean cloth to clean your eyes.” There was a towel in Melissa's house. But it was dirty. And Alex's hands also were dirty.~!~then (NP Alex ) (VP said ) (NP to Melissa ) [ ,_“ (NP I ) (VP will[Pre-Verbal] try ) [ (NP ) (VP to[Pre-Verbal] clean ) (NP (NP _ your ) eye+s[Plural] ) ] ] . but (NP I ) (VP don`t[Pre-Verbal] have ) (NP a[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP clean ) cloth ) [ to (NP ) (VP clean ) (NP (NP _ your ) eye+s[Plural] ) ] . ” (NP there[Existential_Expletive] ) (VP (VP was ) ) (NP a[Pre-Nominal] towel ) (NP in (NP _ Melissa+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) house ) . but (NP it ) (VP was ) (AdjP dirty ) . and (NP (NP _ Alex+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) hand+s[Plural] (AdvP also ) ) (VP were ) (AdjP dirty ) .
So Alex said to Melissa, “I'll call Netty so that she could look at your eyes. Netty will help you so that your eyes could become well.”

Then Netty came to Melissa's house. After Netty looked at Melissa's eyes, she said to Melissa, “Your eyes are very sick. Some germs entered your eyes. We have to wash your eyes. And we have to clean your eyes thoroughly. We have to clean your eyes each day until they become healthy again.”

Then Netty washed her hands with clean water thoroughly and put clean water in a teaspoon. Then she put some salt in that water and dipped a small piece of cloth in it. Then she washed Melissa's left eye with that cloth.
After Netty washed Melissa's left eye, she burned that cloth and washed her hands thoroughly again. Then she told Alex to clean Melissa's other eye.
Netty said to Alex, “Before you clean Melissa's eye, you have to wash your hands first. And you have to use a clean cloth. Then the germs won't spread.”

After Netty and Alex finished washing Melissa's eyes, she said, “I'm able to see now!” Then Netty said to Alex, “You have to burn that cloth. And you have to wash your hands thoroughly.”~!~[ after (NP Netty ) (NP and Alex ) (VP finish+ed[Past_Tense] wash+ing[Participle] ) (NP (NP _ Melissa+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) eye+s[Plural] ) , ] (NP she ) (VP said ) [ ,_“ (NP I ) (VP am ) (AdjP able [ (NP ) (VP to[INFL] see ) (AdvP now ) ] ) ! ” ] . then (NP Netty ) (VP said ) (NP to Alex ) [ ,_“ (NP you ) (VP have_to[Mood] burn ) (NP that[Proximity] cloth ) ] . and (NP you ) (VP have_to[Mood] wash ) (NP (NP _ your ) hand+s[Plural] ) (AdvP thoroughly ) . ”

But Janet's eyes still were sore. So Janet asked Melissa to clean her eyes. Then Melissa said to Janet, “I'll clean your eyes.” But Alex said to Melissa, “You have to wash your hands first. And you have to use a clean cloth.”

So Melissa did all of the things that Alex said. She cleaned Janet's left eye thoroughly and burned that cloth. And she washed her hands and washed Janet's right eye with another cloth. Then she also burned that cloth and washed her hands again.~!~so (NP Melissa ) (VP did ) (NP (AdjP all of ) the[Article] thing+s[Plural] [ that[Relativizer] (NP Alex ) (VP said ) (NP ) ] ) . Melissa burned that cloth so that the germs wouldn't spread. And she washed her hands so that the germs wouldn't spread. Then Alex asked Netty, “Why did Melissa's eyes and Janet's eyes become sick? Why did Melissa's eyes and Janet's eyes become red?”~!~(NP Melissa ) (VP burn+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP that[Pre-Nominal] cloth ) [ so_that (NP the[Pre-Nominal] germ+s[Plural] ) (VP wouldn`t[Pre-Verbal] spread ) ] . and (NP she ) (VP wash+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP (NP _ her ) hand+s[Plural] ) [ so_that (NP the[Pre-Nominal] germ+s[Plural] ) (VP wouldn`t[Pre-Verbal] spread ) ] . then (NP Alex ) (VP ask+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP Netty ) [ ,_“ (NP (AdvP why ) ) (VP did[CP-VP] ) (NP (NP _ Melissa+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) eye+s[Plural] ) (NP and (NP _ Janet+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) eye+s[Plural] ) (VP become ) (AdjP sick ) ? ] . Netty said, “If a dirty towel touches your eyes, germs will enter them. Whenever you touch your eyes with dirty hands, germs also enter them. If you wash your face with dirty water, germs will enter your eyes.”

Then Melissa said to Netty, “We have to clean our eyes carefully!” Netty agreed with Melissa. Netty said to Melissa, “Whenever you wash your eyes, you have to wash them with clean water. You have to also wash your face and your eyes with clean water each day.~!~then (NP Melissa ) (VP said ) (NP to Netty ) [ ,_“ (NP we ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] clean ) (NP (NP _ our ) eye+s[Plural] ) (AdvP carefully ) ! ” ] . You have to chase all of the flies away from your house. And you have to take all of the garbage away from your house. You should eat three kinds of food each day. Fresh food is the best food. And before you eat, you have to wash your hands.
